feed.title: [RFC] Proposal: Base58 encoded HD Wallet root key with optional encryption

entry.title: [RFC] Proposal: Base58 encoded HD Wallet root key with optional encryption
entry.summary: In an email thread discussing key stretching for wallets, William Yager suggests allowing semi-trusted devices to do the heavy lifting, but Pavol Rusnak points out that a compromised computer would remove most of the security offered by key stretching. However, they reach a compromise with the inclusion of PBKDF2-HMAC-SHA512 based KDFs, which are easy to implement even on memory-constrained devices and can still run in reasonable time on slow embedded ARM processors despite aggressive rounds.
